Package bcu.cmp5332.librarysystem.data

Class PatronDataManager

java.lang.Object
bcu.cmp5332.librarysystem.data.PatronDataManager
All Implemented Interfaces:
DataManager
public class PatronDataManager
extends java.lang.Object
implements DataManager
PatronDataManager class is used to load and store Patron data using the text file storage.

It is an implementation of the DataManager interface. It has a RESOURCE field that holds the path to the text file (patrons.txt) that will be used as storage for the Patron data.

The loadData(Library) method loads data from patrons.txt file to the library and the storeData(Library) method stores the patron data that exist in the library to patrons.txt file.

See Also:
loadData(Library), storeData(Library), RESOURCE, DataManager, Library, Patron

  • Method Details

    • loadData

      public void loadData​(Library library) throws java.io.IOException, LibraryException
      Load data from the file storage to the library.

      The method opens the file that holds the patron data using the RESOURCE field and creates a Scanner object to read it. Then it reads each line and splits it in parts using the predefined DataManager.SEPARATOR (::). The result is an array of strings with each of the strings representing a different Patron property. Then the function assigns each of the string parts to its corresponding property (the properties are stored in a specific predefined order) of a Patron object. Finally the new Patron is added to the library. If the patron id can't be parsed to an integer a LibraryException is thrown.

      Specified by:
      loadData in interface DataManager
      Parameters:
      library - the library object where the data will be loaded to
      Throws:
      java.io.IOException - if the file is not found or can't be read.
      LibraryException - if the id of the patron that is being read can't be parsed to an integer
      See Also:
      RESOURCE, Scanner, String.split(String, int), DataManager.SEPARATOR, storeData(Library), Library.addPatron(Patron)

    • storeData

      public void storeData​(Library library) throws java.io.IOException
      Store data from the library to the text file storage.

      The method creates a new FileWriter object using the RESOURCE field and then creates a PrintWriter that will be used to write characters to the FileWriter. The PrintWriter is initialised using the try-with-resources statement to take care of properly closing the resources. Then for each patron that is found on the library's patron list, a new line is written to the file containing the Patron properties in a specific order. After each property, the predefined DataManager.SEPARATOR is added.

      Specified by:
      storeData in interface DataManager
      Parameters:
      library - the library object whose data will be stored in the file
      Throws:
      java.io.IOException - if the file is corrupt or can't be written
      See Also:
      RESOURCE, FileWriter, PrintWriter, Library.getPatrons(), DataManager.SEPARATOR
